sen.j: ツヌグイ・イクグイは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Tsunugui and Ikugui are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Tsunugui and Ikugui are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).
Tsunugui and Ikugui are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).

sen.j: 神世七代の第4代の神で、ツヌグイが男神、イクグイが女神である。
sen.e: Tsunugui and Ikugui are the 4th generations among the Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Tsunugui is a god and Ikugui is a goddess.
Tsunugui and Ikugui are from the 4th generation of Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Tsunugui is a god and Ikugui is a goddess.
Tsunugui and Ikugui are from the 4th generation of Kaminoyonanayo (seven generations of the gods' world, The Primordial Seven); Tsunugui is a god and Ikugui is a goddess.

sen.j: 「クイ（クヒ）」は「芽ぐむ」などの「クム」で、
sen.e: Kui (or kuhi)' ('gui' in the names of Tsunugui and Ikugui are actually euphonic changes of 'kui') has a similar meaning to 'kumu (or gumu)' as seen in 'megumu' (to sprout).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kui (or kuhi)' ('gui' in the names of Tsunugui and Ikugui are actually euphonic changes of 'kui') has a similar meaning to 'kumu (or gumu)' as seen in 'megumu' (to sprout).
Kui (or kuhi)' ('gui' in the names of Tsunugui and Ikugui are actually euphonic changes of 'kui') has a similar meaning to 'kumu' (or gumu) as seen in 'megumu' (to sprout).

sen.j: 「角ぐむ」は角のように芽が出はじめる意、
sen.e: Tsunogumu' is the original word for 'Tsunugui,' which means sprouting a bud which looks like a horn.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tsunogumu' is the original word for 'Tsunugui,' which means sprouting a bud which looks like a horn.
Tsunogumu' is the original word for 'Tsunugui,' which means sprouting a bud which looks like a horn.

sen.j: 「活ぐむ」は生育しはじめるの意である。
sen.e: Ikugumu' is the original word for 'Ikugumi,' which means starting to grow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ikugumu' is the original word for 'Ikugumi,' which means starting to grow.
Ikugumu' is the original word for 'Ikugumi,' which means starting to grow.

sen.j: 泥土が段々固まってきたことにより、生物が発成し育つことができるようになったことを示す神名である。
sen.e: These are names that imply mud had become hard and plants came to be able to sprout and grow.
These are names that imply that mud had become hard and plants came to be able to sprout and grow.
These are names that imply that mud had become hard and plants came to be able to sprout and grow.
